「The Five Directions first take form in chaos,
Heaven and Earth, Sun and Moon array the Three Principles.
The Circulating Heaven and Square Symbols arrange the Star Battles,
Yin and Yang clear the Earth and muddle the Sky—
Wind, rain, thunder, and lightning are all **qi** of emptiness.
Hollows and ridges, waters wide, hold auspicious secrets.
Heaven’s high and Earth’s low divide rank—
Place them rightly, align with Nature’s order, and blessings flow.
Arrange them in sequence, the **Xuanwu** and **Juwu** form pairs,
The four seasons and eight festivals divide day and night.
The Nine Palaces and Eight **Guas** connect with the Heavenly **Gang**,
The Five Phases inverted, turning cycles a thousandfold.
Gold, wood, water, fire, and earth in the central void—
One hundred twenty deities and **Sha** converge.
Ninety-four ranks of auspicious and inauspicious generals,
Some years and months bring fortune, some bring calamity.
Some days and times are blessed, some are ill-fated—
**Xuanwu** high and **Gen** low bring thriving descendants,
**Xun** above and **Kui** below bring great fortune and prosperity.
**Li** above, the **Dragon** descends to the tomb’s site—
Descendants shall rise as scholars and officials through generations.
Fields and households flourish yearly, purple robes and golden belts adorn the court.
A winding path before the gate—
Glory and honor stretch far through ages.
Northwest roads, **qi** soaring—
This place is called the Auspicious **Zhuang**,
Each household prospers, wealth abounds.
Flat before, high behind—hard to endure,
High before, low behind—broad fields secure.
East low, west high is **Ze** land—
Fortune decrees virtuous descendants,
Stable and unyielding, wealth and nobility overflow.
Descendants become pillars of the state,
But a pond behind the home brings poverty—
And childlessness, hollowed intestines.
Facing waters head-on harms the Five **Arrows**—
Tuberculosis and disasters shall strike.
If waters surge past two high positions,
Descendants fall into licentiousness, lacking discipline.
Though waters flow without hindrance,
A pond behind the home shall bring gradual ruin.
**Xun** above draws waters—hard to last,
Wealth and nobility, though plentiful, are not truly blessed.
Filth behind the hall is **Jue** land—
East-north **Arrows** are hardest to defend,
Yet fortune fades swiftly—
Fifteen years hence, ruin is certain.
High behind, low before—supreme fortune,
**Renzi** and **Yang** in power advance cattle and sheep,
Granaries and treasuries flourish,
Wealth and nobility bring great fortune.
Behind, hills rise; before, filth spreads,
Winding paths pierce the Yangtze’s flow—
Fortune grows, descendants thrive, cattle and sheep abound.
Generation after generation enjoys longevity and blessings.
Low on all sides, high in the center—
Waters scatter like a blade of death,
Yet four directions form **Dragon** and **Tiger**,
Twenty-four years bring loss and abandonment.
Before the gate, stones lie—dust swirls,
Bandits and thieves bring misfortune and woe,
Legal disputes and slander year after year,
**Sha** arrows strike unseen—
High on all sides, low in the center—
This place is called the **Hell** Pond,
The household decays, unable to endure.
Narrow before, wide behind—prosperity assured,
The household thrives, fortune overflows,
Descendants prosper, officials come to call,
Fields and gardens rich with mulberry and hemp.
Wide before, narrow behind—no need to speak,
Fortune fades, fields sold bare,
Descendants flee to distant lands,
Only because the gate is wide, inviting disaster.
High winds and broad plains, low heavens—
Grain and harvests abound, commerce thrives,
Carriages and horses follow at the door,
Descendants serve in government halls through generations.
Leftward stretch, rightward shrink—most fortunate.
**Gen** above, the **Dragon** descends, bringing prosperity to descendants and wealth.
Eagle steps, human rites—harmony within the home,
Descendants wear purple robes, herds of pigs, sheep, horses, and cattle gather.
Forty years later, glory rises.
**Zi** and **Wu** full—fortune expands,
Yearly blessings and wealth attract,
Meeting officials brings joy and transformation,
A lifetime of robes and laughter opens wide.
Wealth and fortune, fields and descendants endure,
Yet if **Xuanwu** rises high and **Juwu** sinks low,
Before the gate, **Nine Dragons** coil in channels,
East **Qinglong**, west **Baihu** entwine—
Longevity and blessings pair, orphaned yet honored.
Waters flow on both sides, surging at the center,
High before, low behind—certain hardship,
People and wealth scatter, legal troubles arise,
Bravery invites thieves, women grow wayward.
Waters lap at lonely villages, coming and going—
Within lies mystery, hard to discern.
The common folk do not recognize its subtleties.
Mountains high, people thrive; waters high, wealth flows—
Three **Xuanwu** peaks, **qi** soaring,
Waters flow eastward, then surge back to the hall.
Paths align with **Kun**’s **Dao**, traffic passes freely,
Not kings, but pillars of the state.
Behind the home, green mountains rise six **zhang** high,
Before it, a pond stirs with waves.
Southeast waters roll ceaselessly—
Nine layers ascend to become officials.
Waters depart, mountains return—fortune and blessings complete,
Golden belts encircle the waist, virtuous offspring born.
If the **Dragon**’s **Ling** aligns with the tomb’s center,
Descendants through generations shall rise as **Kuiyuan**.
**Chen** and **Mao** green, **Shen** and **Wei** at the end—
**Kan**’s **Qiu** brings fortune and longevity equal.
**Bing** and **Ding**’s winding waters face the **Gong**,
Green robes and elephant belts bow at the **Dan** steps.
**You** high, hills rise; **Mao** low, plains stretch—
At **Wu**’s edge, broad and filthy behind,
Men and women within bring chaos, no high or low.
Widows in the chamber suffer loneliness,
Wide and level on all sides—
Wherever you build your home, it stands secure.
No need to ask of mountains or waters,
The household prospers in all things.
Behind the camp, ditches and rivers—avoid at all cost,
Descendants scatter east and west,
Yin’s eyes watch, bringing harm,
Little food, no clothing—widows suffer loneliness.
Grass bright and clear, colors fine—
A home in the center brings praise from all.
This place is called the **Dragon**’s **Xue**,
Building here ensures glory and fortune,
All wishes granted, the household thrives.
Buy neighboring fields on left and right,
Do not dig three to four **chi** deep—
Light soil before, narrow behind—luxury assured,
A path before the tomb is hardest to endure,
Descendants scatter far and wide,
Yet if they remain, poverty shall prevail.
Twenty years later, the household falls.
The land like a steamed bun, low on all sides—
Waters flow in four directions through the **Chang** River,
High ridges and peaks make building difficult,
Cut off winds, and set up camp—avoid at all cost.
Eight winds disperse the people, fortune ends.
Misjudge time and fate, and luck shall sink.
Waters pierce green mountains—rare in the world,
**Dragon** coils, **Tiger** encircles—both well-suited.
**Xuanwu** like a peak, high six positions,
A single stone in the center as the tomb’s base.»

「Bright and prosperous, the household thrives,
Fields and cattle abound, wealth fully stored—
This land on both sides nurtures **auspicious qi**,
In twenty years, fortune leaps like a dragon in the pool.

Chicken and Coordinate **Xing** (卯) contend—most excellent,
Dig deep three **chi** to find the **Dragon Pond**—
Do not doubt the left and right hold **Dragon bones**,
Front narrow, back broad—scaled and fragrant like the **Jinlin Plant**.

Build homes and set up camps—wealth and nobility assured,
Noble offspring shall rise, their names on the golden list.
The **Master of Time** knows not the profound subtleties—
Purple **qi** ascends, radiant far in all directions.

Follow the **absolute peaks** and valleys for the tomb—
Vibrant **Tengshe** coils through the earth, poverty shall grow.
Fields and livestock sold to distant lands,
This blind fool’s eyes are dim—
Before the tomb, two **Jue** ditches are dug,
Behind the camp, a winding mound of earth.
If east and west have paths for men to tread,
Descendants shall be fierce, not gentle.

This land is called **Pasture of Cattle**—
Disaster and misfortune year by year.
Do not doubt the careful digging—
A pair of stones lies hidden within.
Flat land with three **tomb mounds** like towering peaks,
Further joined by **Zhenmao** and the incoming **Dragon**.

North has ridges, west has paths—
A central stone as the tomb’s foundation.
This formation is **Golden Rooster Embracing the Egg**—
Wealth and nobility shall produce heroes.
Do not doubt this place nurtures **auspicious qi**—
Dig deep three **chi** to see the copper gleam.
Behind the dwelling, families rise like peaks,
Just like joined chairs—equal in fortune.
Build homes and set up camps—wealth and nobility assured,
Saints and sages among descendants shall guard the dynasty’s seal.
Stopping winds, gathering **qi**—truly wondrous,
Purple **qi** billows, radiant in all directions.

Tall trees encircle the ridges,
A winding stream flows through the **Chang** River.
East and west, **Dragon** and **Tiger** connect—
Sloping land for camps brings great fortune.

Lotus ponds and lotus fields—men fail to recognize,
Descendants shall be orchids and cassia, voices refined.
Do not doubt the careful deep excavation—
Nine **chi** vines stretch long and strange.
The earth like a drum—most wondrous indeed,
Certainly a place for tombs and camps.
Why seek mountains to join or waters to avoid?
Fortune and prosperity shall gradually rise.

**Xuanwu** high, **Zhushu** low—
If a fortunate man is buried here,
Fields and livestock shall flourish, descendants grow strong.
Later generations in purple robes shall rise,
No mountains before or behind, no waters to cross—
Yet why should honor and fortune align?

Do not doubt the careful digging three to four **chi**—
A cluster of **yang qi** gleams brightly.
Flat plains with ridges—camps here bring great fortune.
If east and west have **divine halls** or temples,
Descendants shall surely have vast fields and granaries.
Beware the **Fengjian** (风箭) piercing through the gate—
Later generations shall meet ruin and defeat.

Build homes and set up camps—do not avoid the **yang** (sun).
Avoiding **yang** disrupts the **yin**, fortune shall not last—
Later generations shall guard empty rooms in solitude.
Do not build homes or set up camps toward the west—
**Kunshen** (坤申) reverses the water, hard to cure.
Though fortune may not last long,
Defeat and scattering shall surely come.

Do not build homes or set up camps toward the north—
The master’s house shall weep with ghosts and spirits.
Young men’s clothes shall all be worn on their backs—
Finances shall dwindle, the master’s house shall break.

Build homes and set up camps toward the southeast—
All things face the **yang**, their **qi** grand and exalted.
Plant pines behind, willows before,
Surround and protect on all sides—
Peace and contentment shall fill the home,
Descendants shall prosper with ancestral **sand** and **water**.

Do not let **mountains** or **waters** encroach upon the **Official’s Peak**—
Fortune shall come without end, gradually ascending.

**Qinglong** (青龙) rises from **Yi** (乙) vein—
**Jingding** (丙丁) tides shall call it forth.
**Gengxin** (庚辛) positions reveal the **Snake’s** form,
**Renji** (壬癸) peaks stack high and grand.

**Wuyi** (戊已) positions—bury one tomb—
Descendants shall rise as **generals** and **ministers**, heroes.

This land is called **Four Ministers’ Ground**—
Camps and dwellings here bring the highest fortune.
Southeast broad and open—build peaks and thresholds,
**Gen** (艮) and **Qian** (乾) face the harbor—most excellent.

**Ze** (泽) and **Xi** (西) curves embrace the edges—
Let anyone build homes or tombs here.
This land is called **Phoenix Ground**—
Spring colors face the **yang** in all seasons.
If a fortunate man is buried here,
Descendants shall wear purple robes through generations.

**Jing** (丙) brings ditches and **Ding** (丁) brings streams,
**Xinyou** (辛酉)—**Qinglong** sets forth the boat.
Four **Jue** ditches form the four feet—
Named **Turtle Ground**, excellent for building towers.

Whether living or buried here,
Descendants shall be strong, their fields vast.
Pigs, sheep, cattle, and horses walk in crowds—
Honor and wealth shall produce **nobles**.

**Xuanwu** high, hills embrace—
With waters, with granaries—abundant wealth.
Where **mountains** and **waters** meet—most auspicious.

A winding stream flows toward the incoming—
This land is called **Lion Ground**—
Descendants shall hold **Hu** (笏) and bow in harmony.

Build homes and set up camps toward the southeast—
Avoid the flowing waters, examine the ridges carefully.
Within the courtyard, waters emerge from the **Chang** River’s edge,
Wells and springs must hide toward the **Mao** (卯) side.
Open doors—do not violate the **Tianxiang** (天罡) decree,
Three, five, six, seven—disaster like mountains.
Or like the **Caimen** (财门) of four, six, seven—
A harmonious home, filial children bring the father’s peace.

The main hall faces forward, one wall slightly offset—
Do not call the **Fengjian** (风箭) to pierce the gate.
Heaven’s patterns and Earth’s logic are violated—
The **Nine Palaces** and **Eight Trigrams** determine **yin** and **yang**.

Build homes and set up camps—no direction is forbidden,
Whether flat plains or mountain ridges—
Do not question the **Guo** (郭) and **Mao** (摸) of the **Tianxiang** decree.
All manner of camps shall bring household prosperity—
Why court disaster by connecting the flat?
The master’s gate shall break, the population shall dwindle.

The **Gen** (艮) formation’s secret decree is unknown—
Only when known shall **Guo** (郭) and **Mao** (摸) reveal their **yin** and **yang**.

Here, imperial sons bring joyous blessings—
No one knows to conceal the **Heaven’s Mechanism**.
Build homes and set up camps—no need for a **Master**—
Whether ridges or high or low—
Further, the year and month must be auspicious.
Why seek the **Master** of **yin** and **yang** decrees?
The household shall break, its people shall suffer.

He speaks of **times** and **fates** misaligned—
This **Heaven’s Mechanism** is truly a wondrous decree.
Fear that later generations shall err in their search—
Discuss the **Jin Suo** (金锁) with weighty deliberation.
Sweep away all **Masters**—none shall have fine attention.
Only those who recognize **Heaven’s Patterns** and **Earth’s Logic**
Shall know the wondrous principles worth a thousand gold.

**Jin Suo** (金锁) and **Yu Guan** (玉关) are not easy to grasp—
Master them thoroughly, do not treat them lightly.

**Immortal** families secretly transmit the true **mouth decree**—
Carefully ponder and reflect—
Poverty shall not last beyond thirteen years.
Observe how the household breaks and its people dwindle.

Waters pierce green mountains—rare in the world,
**Dragon** coils, **Tiger** resides—both well-suited.»
